title: Conditions for a One-Sample $t$-Test
question_text: A company wishes to find out the number of one of its products its customers buy per year. It decides to sample its customers to estimate the population mean of its number of sales. Which of the following lists a set of conditions needed to verify running a one-sample $t$-test?

choices.text:
It chooses to sample
100
of its customers. These customers will be chosen randomly from a list of its
500
customers who buy this product each year.

It chooses to sample
100
of its customers. These customers will be selected from a list of its
2000
customers who buy this product each year.

It chooses to sample
100
of its customers. These customers will be chosen randomly from a list of its
2000
customers who buy this product each year.

It chooses to sample
20
of its customers who will be chosen randomly from its list of
400
customers who buy the product each year. Two of these
20
customers are atypical, purchasing abnormally large amounts of the item.
